Content:: Working Environment (Air Pollution, Noise and Vibration) Convention, 1977 is an International Labour Organization Convention. It was established in 1977, with the preamble stating: Having decided upon the adoption of certain proposals with regard to working environment: atmospheric pollution, noise and vibration,... As of 2013, the convention had been ratified by 45 states. This article related to international law is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
